screen_desc: You're viewing a screenshot of the Messages app on a mobile phone. The main screen is currently empty, indicating that no conversations have been started yet, with a prompt saying "Once you start a new conversation, you'll see it listed here." There is a blue button at the bottom labeled "Start chat," which suggests that you can begin a new conversation by tapping it. Additionally, there is a notification about "New! Spam protection" informing the user that some data about messages (but not the content) is sent to Google to help protect against spam, with options to learn more or manage the settings.

Find the 'NewsBreak: Local News & Alerts' app on the home screen or app drawer. If the app is not found, open the Google Play Store to install it.
Navigate to the login screen within the 'NewsBreak' app.
